==Japanese==
{{ja-kanjitab|ほん|しょ|yomi=on}}

===Etymology===
May be from {{etyl|ltc|ja|sort=ほんしょ}} compound {{m|zh|本書|tr=pwon<sup>X</sup> syo|lit=trunk; main + writing}}.  Compare modern {{etyl|cmn|-}} reading ''běnshū'', {{etyl|yue|-}} ''bun<sup>2</sup> syu<sup>1</sup>'', {{etyl|hak|-}} ''pún-sû''.

Alternatively, may have been composed in Japan of {{etyl|ltc|-}}-derived components, as a compound of {{m|ja|本|tr=hon||main; this}} + {{m|ja|書|tr=sho||writing; document; book}}.

===Pronunciation===
{{ja-pron|yomi=goon|ほんしょ|acc=1|acc_ref=DJR}}

===Noun===
{{ja-noun|ほんしょ}}

# the [[main]] [[text]] {{qualifier|as opposed to [[appendix|appendices]] etc.}}
# an [[official]] [[document]] {{qualifier|as opposed to a [[draft]]}}
# an [[original]] document {{qualifier|as opposed to a [[copy]]}}
# a [[core]] document {{qualifier|as for a school of thought or religion}}
# [[this]] [[document]], this [[text]], this [[book]] {{qualifier|as previously mentioned in the current context}}
